page.title: 10Tourism
page.content: Access to the island is curbed by the necessity of having written permission to land, this provision was introduced around 1890. Inchkeith was recently bought by Mr.T. Farmer, who has plans to turn it into an adventure playground for children. Despite the fact that officially permission is required before landing on the island nowadays many visitors simply come and go at will, often taking a Sunday afternoon trip out there if they have a boat. The island offers peace and quite away from the bussle of the tourists on the Fife and Lothian beaches. If Mr.Farmers plans to not come to fruition the island is destined to become uninhabited as the lighthouse is earmarked for automation.
